metadata.title: CVE-2017-7244 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
The _pcre32_xclass function in pcre_xclass.c in libpcre1 in PCRE 8.40 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (invalid memory read) via a crafted file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-7244` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre16-3 - 2:8.39-3
libpcre3 - 2:8.39-3
libpcre32-3 - 2:8.39-3
libpcrecpp0v5 - 2:8.39-3
pcregrep - 2:8.39-3
No subscription required

notes.note: mdeslaur> pcre32 support enabled only in pcre3/1:8.35-4 same commit as CVE-2017-7186

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:8.39-3').
